name: Study
description: Make an Intelligence check to study your memory, a book, a clue, or another source of knowledge and recall important information
requirements: Must have at least one applicable skill (Arcana, History, Investigation, Nature, or Religion)
Must have access to something to study (memory, book, clue, etc.)

effects.description: When you take the Study action, you make an Intelligence check to study your memory, a book, a clue, or another source of knowledge and call to mind an important piece of information about it.
mechanicalEffects: Make an Intelligence check using an appropriate skill
Arcana: Recall lore about spells, magic items, eldritch symbols, magical traditions, planes of existence, and certain creatures (Aberrations, Constructs, Elementals, Fey, Monstrosities)
History: Recall information about historic events, people, ancient civilizations, wars, and certain creatures (Giants and Humanoids)
Investigation: Decipher traps, ciphers, riddles, and gadgetry
Nature: Recall knowledge about terrain, flora, weather, and certain creatures (Beasts, Dragons, Oozes, Plants)
Religion: Recall information about deities, religious hierarchies, rites, holy symbols, cults, and certain creatures (Celestials, Fiends, Undead)

restrictions: Must have something to study or knowledge to recall
GM determines which skill applies to the topic
Information gained depends on the check result and what knowledge exists
Cannot recall information you have no way of knowing
examples: A wizard uses Arcana to identify the properties of a magical rune
A scholar uses History to recall information about an ancient empire
A detective uses Investigation to decode a cipher left at a crime scene
A druid uses Nature to predict upcoming weather patterns
A cleric uses Religion to identify a deity's holy symbol

areasOfKnowledge.arcana: Spells, magic items, eldritch symbols, magical traditions, planes of existence, and certain creatures (Aberrations, Constructs, Elementals, Fey, and Monstrosities)
areasOfKnowledge.history: Historic events and people, ancient civilizations, wars, and certain creatures (Giants and Humanoids)
areasOfKnowledge.nature: Terrain, flora, weather, and certain creatures (Beasts, Dragons, Oozes, and Plants)
areasOfKnowledge.religion: Deities, religious hierarchies and rites, holy symbols, cults, and certain creatures (Celestials, Fiends, and Undead)

additionalRules.usingReferences: If you have access to a relevant book, scroll, or other reference material, the GM might grant you Advantage on the check or provide additional information
additionalRules.expertise: If you have Expertise in a relevant skill, your Proficiency Bonus is doubled for the check
